com.example.zoomwroom.Entities

Class DriveRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.zoomwroom.Entities.DriveRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DriveRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    DriveRequest A DriveRequest stores its requestID, both Rider and Driver's userID, pickup and destination locations, datetime created, suggestedFare generated by the system and offeredFare offered by the rider, and the current status of the request. There are also 4 instance variables of type double just for firebase storing.
    Author:
    Dulong Sang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DriveRequest.Status
      Status values: PENDING Indicate that the request has been posted and waiting for a driver to accept.

      • toFirebaseMode

        public void toFirebaseMode()
        call this method before upload to firebase! Since there is no empty constructor, getters and setters in LatLng class, we have to change a way to storing LatLng objects. In this method, it will set both pickupLocation and destination to null, and set their values to 4 attributes of type double, so that the DriveRequest object can be stored in firebase.

      • toLocalMode

        public void toLocalMode()
        call this method after download from firebase! This method restore pickupLocation and destination attributes.

      • giveStatus

        public static java.lang.String giveStatus(int status)
        Converts the int status to a string for display throughout the application. Status 0 returns Accepted Status 1 returns Accepted Status 2 returns Confirmed Status 3 returns Ongoing Status 4 returns Completed Status 5 returns Cancelled Status 6 returns Declined Status 7 returns Aborted Status 8 returns FINALIZED
        Parameters:
        status - int representing current status of the DriveRequest
        Returns:
        String representing the status in a readable format
